info.title: Cluster API reference
info.description:
Configure and manage the Venice cluster.

 API Objects are: Cluster Host Node SmartNIC Tenant

parameters.name: T.kind
parameters.description: Kind represents the type of the API object.

parameters.name: T.api-version
parameters.description: APIVersion defines the version of the API object. This can only be set by the server.

parameters.name: meta.name
parameters.description:
Name of the object, unique within a Namespace for scoped objects.
Should start and end in an alphanumeric character and can contain alphanumner or ._-: characters
minimum length is 2 and maximum length is 64 characters.

parameters.name: meta.tenant
parameters.description:
Tenant is global namespace isolation for various objects. This can be automatically
filled in many cases based on the tenant a user, who created the object, belongs go.
Should start and end in an alphanumeric character and can contain alphanumner or ._-: characters
maximum length is 64 characters.

parameters.name: meta.namespace
parameters.description:
Namespace of the object, for scoped objects.
Should start and end in an alphanumeric character and can contain alphanumner or ._-: characters
maximum length is 64 characters.

parameters.name: meta.generation-id
parameters.description:
GenerationID is the generation Id for the object. This is incremented anytime there
 is an update to the user intent, including Spec update and any update to ObjectMeta.
 System generated and updated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: meta.resource-version
parameters.description:
Resource version in the object store. This is updated anytime there is any change to the object.
 System generated and updated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: meta.uuid
parameters.description:
UUID is the unique identifier for the object. This is generated on creation of the object.
System generated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: meta.creation-time
parameters.description:
CreationTime is the creation time of the object
 System generated and updated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: meta.mod-time
parameters.description:
ModTime is the Last Modification time of the object
 System generated and updated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: meta.self-link
parameters.description:
SelfLink is a link for accessing this object. When the object is served from the API-GW it is the
 URI path. Example:
   - "/v1/tenants/tenants/tenant2" 
 System generated and updated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: spec.quorum-nodes
parameters.description:
QuorumNodes contains the list of hostnames for nodes configured to be quorum
nodes in the cluster.

parameters.name: spec.virtual-ip
parameters.description:
VirtualIP is the IP address for managing the cluster. It will be hosted by
the winner of election between quorum nodes.

parameters.name: spec.ntp-servers
parameters.description: NTPServers contains the list of NTP servers for the cluster.

parameters.name: spec.auto-admit-nics
parameters.description:
AutoAdmitNICs when enabled auto-admits NICs that are validated
into Venice Cluster. When it is disabled, NICs validated by CMD are
set to Pending state and it requires Manual approval to be admitted
into the cluster.

parameters.name: status.leader
parameters.description: Leader contains the node name of the cluster leader.

parameters.name: status.last-leader-transition-time
parameters.description: LastLeaderTransitionTime is when the leadership changed last time.

parameters.name: status.build-version
parameters.description: Human friendly build version.

parameters.name: status.vcs-commit
parameters.description: Representation of ommit in version control system - e.g: hash in git.

parameters.name: status.build-date
parameters.description: Date and Time at which the source code was built.

parameters.name: status.auth-bootstrapped
parameters.description: AuthBootstrapped when set to true indicates that auth has been bootstrapped in cluster.

parameters.name: label-selector
parameters.description: LabelSelector to select on labels in list or watch results.

parameters.name: field-selector
parameters.description: FieldSelector to select on field values in list or watch results.

parameters.name: field-change-selector
parameters.description: FieldChangeSelector specifies to generate a watch notification on change in field(s) specified.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
from represents the start offset (zero based), used for pagination.
results returned would be in the range [from ... from+max-results-1].

parameters.name: max-results
parameters.description: max. number of events to be fetched for the request.

parameters.name: status.admitted-smart-nics
parameters.description: AdmittedSmartNICs contains a list of admitted SmartNICs that are on this host.

parameters.name: status.phase
parameters.description: Current lifecycle phase of the node.

parameters.name: status.quorum
parameters.description: Quorum node or not.

parameters.name: spec.admit
parameters.description: Admit allows a SmartNIC to join the cluster.

parameters.name: spec.hostname
parameters.description: Hostname is used as a user friendly identifier in logs/events.

parameters.name: ip-config.ip-address
parameters.description: IPAddress contains the Management IP address of the SmartNIC in CIDR format.

parameters.name: ip-config.default-gw
parameters.description: DefaultGW contains the default gateway's IP address.

parameters.name: ip-config.dns-servers
parameters.description: DNSServers contains a list of DNS Servers that can be used on SmartNIC.

parameters.name: spec.mgmt-mode
parameters.description: MgmtMode defines the management mode of the SmartNIC.

parameters.name: spec.network-mode
parameters.description: MgmtMode defines the management mode of the SmartNIC.

parameters.name: spec.mgmt-vlan
parameters.description:
MgmtVlan defines the vlan to be used in network managed mode. The default of 0
means we use untagged-vlan for doing inband management. value should be between 0 and 4095

parameters.name: spec.controllers
parameters.description: Controllers contains the list of remote controllers IP addresses or hostnames.

parameters.name: status.admission-phase
parameters.description:
Current admission phase of the SmartNIC.
When auto-admission is enabled, AdmissionPhase will be set to NIC_ADMITTED
by CMD for validated NICs.
When auto-admission is not enabled, AdmissionPhase will be set to NIC_PENDING
by CMD for validated NICs since it requires manual approval.
To admit the NIC as a part of manual admission, user is expected to
set Spec.Admit to true for the NICs that are in NIC_PENDING
state. Note : Whitelist mode is not supported yet.

parameters.name: status.serial-num
parameters.description: Serial number.

parameters.name: status.primary-mac
parameters.description: PrimaryMAC is the MAC address of the primary PF exposed by SmartNIC.

parameters.name: ip-config.ip-address
parameters.description: IPAddress contains the Management IP address of the SmartNIC in CIDR format.

parameters.name: ip-config.default-gw
parameters.description: DefaultGW contains the default gateway's IP address.

parameters.name: ip-config.dns-servers
parameters.description: DNSServers contains a list of DNS Servers that can be used on SmartNIC.

parameters.name: bios-info.vendor
parameters.description: Vendor name.

parameters.name: bios-info.version
parameters.description: BIOS version.

parameters.name: bios-info.fw-major-ver
parameters.description: Firmware major release info.

parameters.name: bios-info.fw-minor-ver
parameters.description: Firmware minor release info.

parameters.name: os-info.type
parameters.description:
OS Name
Eg: GNU/Linux.

parameters.name: os-info.kernel-relase
parameters.description:
Kernel release
Eg: 3.10.0-514.10.2.el7.x86_64.

parameters.name: os-info.kernel-version
parameters.description:
Kernel version
Eg: #1 SMP Fri Mar 3 00:04:05 UTC 2017.

parameters.name: os-info.processor
parameters.description:
Processor Info
Eg: x86_64.

parameters.name: cpu-info.speed
parameters.description: CPU speed per core, eg: 2099998101.

parameters.name: cpu-info.num-sockets
parameters.description: Number of CPU sockets, eg: 2, 4.

parameters.name: cpu-info.num-cores
parameters.description: Number of physical CPU cores per socket, eg: 36.

parameters.name: cpu-info.num-threads
parameters.description: Number of threads per core, eg: 2.

parameters.name: memory-info.type
parameters.description: Type.

parameters.name: memory-info.size
parameters.description: Memory size in bytes, eg: 274760318976.

GenerationID is the generation Id for the object. This is incremented anytime there
 is an update to the user intent, including Spec update and any update to ObjectMeta.
 System generated and updated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: O.resource-version
parameters.description:
Resource version in the object store. This is updated anytime there is any change to the object.
 System generated and updated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: O.uuid
parameters.description:
UUID is the unique identifier for the object. This is generated on creation of the object.
System generated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: O.creation-time
parameters.description:
CreationTime is the creation time of the object
 System generated and updated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: O.mod-time
parameters.description:
ModTime is the Last Modification time of the object
 System generated and updated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: O.self-link
parameters.description:
SelfLink is a link for accessing this object. When the object is served from the API-GW it is the
 URI path. Example:
   - "/v1/tenants/tenants/tenant2" 
 System generated and updated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: label-selector
parameters.description: LabelSelector to select on labels in list or watch results.

parameters.name: field-selector
parameters.description: FieldSelector to select on field values in list or watch results.

parameters.name: field-change-selector
parameters.description: FieldChangeSelector specifies to generate a watch notification on change in field(s) specified.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
from represents the start offset (zero based), used for pagination.
results returned would be in the range [from ... from+max-results-1].

parameters.name: max-results
parameters.description: max. number of events to be fetched for the request.

get.summary: Watch Node objects. Supports WebSockets or HTTP long poll

parameters.name: O.name
parameters.description:
Name of the object, unique within a Namespace for scoped objects.
Should start and end in an alphanumeric character and can contain alphanumner or ._-: characters
minimum length is 2 and maximum length is 64 characters.

parameters.name: O.tenant
parameters.description:
Tenant is global namespace isolation for various objects. This can be automatically
filled in many cases based on the tenant a user, who created the object, belongs go.
Should start and end in an alphanumeric character and can contain alphanumner or ._-: characters
maximum length is 64 characters.

maximum length is 64 characters.

apiObjectMeta.description: ObjectMeta contains metadata that all objects stored in kvstore must have.

namespace.description: Namespace of the object, for scoped objects.

kind.description: Kind represents the type of the API object.

name.description: Name of the object, unique within a Namespace for scoped objects.

uri.description: URI is a link to accessing the referenced object.

apiObjectRef.description: ObjectRef contains identifying information about an object.

result.description: Result contains the status of the operation, success or failure.

message.description: Message contains human readable form of the error.

code.description: Code is the HTTP status code.

object-ref.description: Reference to the object (optional) for which this status is being sent.

apiStatus.description: Status is returned for calls that dont return objects.

apiStatusResult.description: StatusResult contains possible statuses for a NIC.

kind.description: Kind represents the type of the API object.

api-version.title: APIVersion defines the version of the API object. This can only be set by the server

apiTypeMeta.description: TypeMeta contains the metadata about kind and version for all API objects.

clusterAutoMsgClusterWatchHelper.title: AutoMsgClusterWatchHelper is a wrapper object for watch events for Cluster objects

clusterAutoMsgHostWatchHelper.title: AutoMsgHostWatchHelper is a wrapper object for watch events for Host objects

clusterAutoMsgNodeWatchHelper.title: AutoMsgNodeWatchHelper is a wrapper object for watch events for Node objects

clusterAutoMsgSmartNICWatchHelper.title: AutoMsgSmartNICWatchHelper is a wrapper object for watch events for SmartNIC objects

clusterAutoMsgTenantWatchHelper.title: AutoMsgTenantWatchHelper is a wrapper object for watch events for Tenant objects

num-cores.title: Number of physical CPU cores per socket, eg: 36

num-threads.title: Number of threads per core, eg: 2

spec.description: Spec contains the configuration of the cluster.

status.description: Status contains the current state of the cluster.

clusterCluster.description:
Cluster represents a full cluster venice and workload nodes

Entity responsible & scenarios involved in managing this object:

     Create:
         o NetOps-admin
             - initial cluster creation
     Modify:
         o NetOps-admin
             - update spec attributes
         o CMD
             - update status attributes
     Delete:
         o NetOps-admin
             - TBD
clusterCluster.title: --------------------------------- CLUSTER ---------------------------------------------

clusterClusterAuthBootstrapRequest.title: ClusterAuthBootstrapRequest is to set auth bootstrap flag in cluster

clusterClusterList.title: ClusterList is a container object for list of Cluster objects

quorum-nodes.description:
QuorumNodes contains the list of hostnames for nodes configured to be quorum
nodes in the cluster.

virtual-ip.description:
VirtualIP is the IP address for managing the cluster. It will be hosted by
the winner of election between quorum nodes.

ntp-servers.description: NTPServers contains the list of NTP servers for the cluster.

auto-admit-nics.description:
AutoAdmitNICs when enabled auto-admits NICs that are validated
into Venice Cluster. When it is disabled, NICs validated by CMD are
set to Pending state and it requires Manual approval to be admitted
into the cluster.

clusterClusterSpec.description: ClusterSpec contains the configuration of the cluster.

leader.description: Leader contains the node name of the cluster leader.

last-leader-transition-time.title: LastLeaderTransitionTime is when the leadership changed last time

vcs-commit.title: Representation of ommit in version control system - e.g: hash in git

build-date.title: Date and Time at which the source code was built

auth-bootstrapped.title: AuthBootstrapped when set to true indicates that auth has been bootstrapped in cluster

clusterClusterStatus.description: ClusterStatus contains the current state of the Cluster.

spec.description: Spec contains the configuration of the host.

status.description: Status contains the current state of the host.

clusterHost.description: Host represents a Baremetal or Hypervisor server.
clusterHost.title: ---------------------------------- HOST ------------------------------------

clusterHostList.title: HostList is a container object for list of Host objects

smart-nics.title: SmartNICs contains the information about all SmartNICs on a host

clusterHostSpec.description: HostSpec contains the configuration of the Host.

admitted-smart-nics.title: AdmittedSmartNICs contains a list of admitted SmartNICs that are on this host

clusterHostStatus.description: HostStatus contains the current state of the Host.

ip-address.title: IPAddress contains the Management IP address of the SmartNIC in CIDR format

default-gw.title: DefaultGW contains the default gateway's IP address

dns-servers.title: DNSServers contains a list of DNS Servers that can be used on SmartNIC

clusterIPConfig.title: IPConfig defines the static IP configuration for a SmartNIC

meta.title: Object name is Serial-Number of the SmartNIC

spec.description: NetworkInterfaceSpec contains the configuration of the network adapter.

status.description: NetworkInterfaceStatus contains the current state of the network adapter.

host-ifname.title: interface name seen by the host driver

clusterNetworkInterfaceHostStatus.title: NetworkInterfaceHostStatus is populated for PF and VF

link-speed.title: Should we allow manual configuration of the link speed, or only through a profile

primary-mac.description: should be a valid MAC address

spec.description: Spec contains the configuration of the node.

status.description: Status contains the current state of the node.

clusterNode.description: Node is representation of a single Venice node in the system.
clusterNode.title: ---------------------------------- NODE -------------------------------------------

type.title: Type indicates a certain node condition

last-transition-time.title: The last time the condition transitioned

reason.title: The reason for the condition's last transition

message.description: A detailed message indicating details about the transition.

clusterNodeCondition.description: NodeCondition describes the state of a Node at a certain point.

clusterNodeList.title: NodeList is a container object for list of Node objects

clusterNodeSpec.description: NodeSpec contains the configuration of the node.

phase.description: Current lifecycle phase of the node.

clusterNodeStatus.description: NodeStatus contains the current state of the node.

kernel-version.title:
Kernel version
Eg: #1 SMP Fri Mar 3 00:04:05 UTC 2017

meta.title: Object name is Serial-Number of the SmartNIC

spec.description: SmartNICSpec contains the configuration of the network adapter.

status.description: SmartNICStatus contains the current state of the network adapter.

clusterSmartNIC.description:
SmartNIC represents the Naples I/O subsystem

Entity responsible & scenarios involved in managing this object:

     Create:
         o CMD
             - created as part of NIC registration, Admittance
     Modify:
         o CMD
             - update spec attributes
             - update status attributes
     Delete:
         o CMD
             - aging out stale or rejected NICs (TBD)
         o NetOps, SecOps
             - Decomission a NIC (TBD)
clusterSmartNIC.title: ------------------------------------ SMART NIC  -------------------------------------------

type.title: Type indicates a certain NIC condition

last-transition-time.title: The last time the condition transitioned

reason.title: The reason for the condition's last transition

message.description: A detailed message indicating details about the transition.

clusterSmartNICCondition.description: SmartNICCondition describes the state of a SmartNIC at a certain point.

name.title: Name contains the name of the SmartNIC on a host

mac-address.title: MACAddress contains the primary MAC address of a SmartNIC

clusterSmartNICID.title: SmartNICID contains the identifying information of a SmartNIC

clusterSmartNICList.title: SmartNICList is a container object for list of SmartNIC objects

admit.title: Admit allows a SmartNIC to join the cluster

hostname.title: Hostname is used as a user friendly identifier in logs/events

ip-config.title: IPConfig defines the static IP configuration. If not specified, DHCP will be attempted

mgmt-mode.title: MgmtMode defines the management mode of the SmartNIC

network-mode.title: MgmtMode defines the management mode of the SmartNIC

mgmt-vlan.title:
MgmtVlan defines the vlan to be used in network managed mode. The default of 0
means we use untagged-vlan for doing inband management

controllers.title: Controllers contains the list of remote controllers IP addresses or hostnames

clusterSmartNICSpec.title: SmartNICSpec contains configuration of the SmartNIC (Naples I/O subsystem)

admission-phase.description:
Current admission phase of the SmartNIC.
When auto-admission is enabled, AdmissionPhase will be set to NIC_ADMITTED
by CMD for validated NICs.
When auto-admission is not enabled, AdmissionPhase will be set to NIC_PENDING
by CMD for validated NICs since it requires manual approval.
To admit the NIC as a part of manual admission, user is expected to
set Spec.Admit to true for the NICs that are in NIC_PENDING
state. Note : Whitelist mode is not supported yet.

primary-mac.title: PrimaryMAC is the MAC address of the primary PF exposed by SmartNIC

ip-config.title: IPConfig is the ip address related configuration obtained from DHCP

clusterSmartNICStatus.title: SmartNICStatus contains current status of a SmartNIC

type.title:
Storage Type (TBD for Naples)
Eg: SATA, SCSI, NVMe  or HDD, SSD, NVMe

spec.description: Spec contains the configuration of the tenant.

status.description: Status contains the current state of the tenant.

clusterTenant.title: Tenant represents an org or a tenant

clusterTenantList.title: TenantList is a container object for list of Tenant objects

type_url.description:
A URL/resource name whose content describes the type of the
serialized protocol buffer message.

For URLs which use the scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, the
following restrictions and interpretations apply:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* The last segment of the URL's path must represent the fully
  qualified name of the type (as in `path/google.protobuf.Duration`).
  The name should be in a canonical form (e.g., leading "." is
  not accepted).
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.
